title: â€˜The Voice of Hind Rajabâ€™ Director Kaouther Ben Hania Set for Career Honor From Italyâ€™s Biografilm Festival (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Hania, whose â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€ is a contender in the 2026 Oscars for Best International Feature, will receive
body:
Tunisian director Kaouther Ben Hania, whose â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajabâ€ is a contender in the 2026 Oscars for Best International Feature, will receive a special tribute at Italyâ€™s Biografilm Festival, the unique event billed as a cinematic celebration of human lives.

	Ben Hania â€“ who in September elicited theÂ longest standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival for â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajab,â€ which premiered to more than 20 minutes of thunderous applause and then won the Silver Lion â€“ will be feted with the festâ€™s International Celebration of Lives Award. According to a statement, the honor is dedicated to â€œrecognizing filmmakers whose work has left an indelible mark on contemporary cinema and the art of real-world storytelling.â€
	

	The director, whose two previous films â€” â€œThe Man Who Sold His Skinâ€ and â€œFour Daughtersâ€ â€” were also Oscar-nominated,Â has been touring the festival circuit with â€œThe Voice of Hind Rajab,â€ which centers on a single, haunting voice: that of a real 5-year-old Palestinian girl trapped inside a car that was attacked by Israeli forces in Gaza and later found dead.


	The Biografilm Festival tribute will see Ben Hania return to the Biografilm Festival following her appearance at the eventâ€™s 2024 edition for the Italian premiere of â€œFour Daughtersâ€ that weaves documentary and fiction, exploring the story of Tunisiaâ€™s Olfa Hamrouni who publicized the radicalization of her two teenage daughters who had left Tunisia to fight with ISIS.

	In a joint statement Biografilm Festival artistic directors Chiara Liberti and Massimo BenvegnÃ¹Â expressed their enthusiasm for this yearâ€™s honoree: â€œIn an era of rapid and ephemeral visual stimuli, Kaouther Ben Haniaâ€™s cinema provides a vital space for resistance and militancy,â€ they said. â€œHer evolution from the intimate, familial narrative of â€˜Four Daughtersâ€™ to the urgent historical testimony of â€˜The Voice of Hind Rajabâ€™ demonstrates a rare mastery. We are honored to celebrate a director who does more than observe reality; she interrogates it with a courage that is as aesthetically bold as it is deeply ethical.â€
	

	Previous recipients of the Celebration of Lives Award award include Werner Herzog, Francis Ford Coppola, Radu Jude, Olivier Assayas, and Francis Ford Coppola.

	The 22nd edition of the Biografilm Festival will run in Bologna June 5-15

schema.headline: â€˜The Voice of Hind Rajabâ€™ Director Kaouther Ben Hania Set for Career Honor From Italyâ€™s Biografilm Festival (EXCLUSIVE)

title: U.K. News Organizations â€”Â Including BBC â€”Â  Form Media Coalition Over AI Publishing Rights to â€˜Protect Original Journalismâ€™
description:
Senior heads across the U.K.â€™s news landscape have come together to form a coalition in the face of AIâ€™s growing influence. 

	In an open letter, BB
body:
Senior heads across the U.K.â€™s news landscape have come together to form a coalition in the face of AIâ€™s growing influence. 

	In an open letter, BBC director-general Tim Davie, Financial Times CEO Jon Slade, The Guardian CEO Anna Bateson, Sky News executive chairman David Rhodes, and Telegraph Media Group CEO Anna Jones have invited â€œglobal leaders across publishing, broadcasting, media and newsâ€ â€” to join as founding members of SPUR (the Standards for Publisher Usage Rights coalition). 
	

	In the letter, the five execs said that AI was â€œfundamentally reshaping how content is created, distributed, discovered and monetisedâ€ and asserted that â€œwe need to come together to protect original journalism and secure the long-term sustainability of our industry.â€


	While AI brought opportunity for publishers and audiences, it also raises â€œurgent questions about fairness, consent, attribution, transparency and trust,â€ they said. 

	â€œAcross the industry, our reporting, our archives, our original content, have become foundational training material for AI systems. This material has been scraped, copied and reused with no common standards to enable permission or payment, weakening the economic model that supports journalism. The lack of transparency about how AI answers are created risks eroding public trust in both the news and the technologies used to access it.â€

	The reported mission of SPUR is to â€œestablish shared technical standards and responsible licensing frameworks that ensure AI developers can access high quality, reliable journalism in legitimate, responsible and convenient ways, while guaranteeing that publishers retain practical control of their content and receive fair value when it is used.â€
	

	According to the letter, it will aim to develop shared industry standards, reduce friction in licensing and â€œbridge the gapâ€ between publishers and AI developers, while also identifying â€œgaps in the technical tools needed to protect intellectual property.â€

schema.headline: U.K. News Organizations â€”Â Including BBC â€”Â  Form Media Coalition Over AI Publishing Rights to â€˜Protect Original Journalismâ€™

title: Warner Bros. Discovery Cuts LossesÂ in Q4,Â Despite Box Office, TV Woes; Nears 132 Million Streaming Subs
description: While at the center of a tug-of-war between Paramount Skydance and Netflix, Warner Bros. Discovery reported its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings results
body:
While at the center of a tug-of-war between Paramount Skydance and Netflix, Warner Bros. Discovery reported its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings results Thursday. 

	According to the David Zaslav-led company, WBD narrowed its losses to $252 million during the October-December quarter and saw streaming subscribers reach nearly 132 million amid an increased international rollout for HBO Max.


	â€œWith the successful recent launches of HBO Max in Germany and Italy, as well as the upcoming launches in the United Kingdom and Ireland on March 26th, we expect to finish the first quarter of 2026 with more than 140 million subscribers, well on our way to more than 150 million subscribers by year end,â€ Warner Bros. Discovery said in a letter to shareholders accompanying the financials.
	

	In these materials, Warner Bros. Discovery stated CEO Zaslav and other WBD brass â€œwill not be answering any questionsâ€ during the earnings call with analysts Thursday regarding WBDâ€™s pending acquisition battle between intended buyer Netflix, which already has a merger agreement in place to buy WBDâ€™s studio and streaming assets, and eager suitor Paramount, which just upped its bid for the whole company, including the linear networks.

	â€œWhile the Netflix Merger Agreement remains in effect and the Board continues to recommend the Netflix transaction and has not withdrawn or modified its recommendation, the Board recently determined that the latest proposal from Paramount Skydance could reasonably be expected to lead to a â€˜company superior proposalâ€™ as defined in the Netflix Merger Agreement,â€ the company wrote. â€œWBD continues to engage with PSKY to determine if a proposal that constitutes such a â€˜company superior proposalâ€™ can be reached. There can be no assurance that the Board will conclude that the transaction proposed by PSKY is superior to the merger with Netflix or that any definitive agreement or transaction will result from Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s discussions with PSKY. The Board remains committed to maximizing shareholder value and certainty while mitigating downside risks, and the Board will evaluate any proposal against that standard with the objective of delivering the best deal for our shareholders.â€
	

	Streaming revenue was up 5% year-over-year to reach $2.8 billion. Sales for the studio segment were down 13% at $3.2 billion. WBDâ€™s global TV channels division saw a 12% drop to $4.2 billion.

	Within the streaming business, distribution sales were up 3% ($2.4 billion) and ad sales jumped 18% to $278 million. 

	Streaming subscribers reached 131.6 million, an increase of 3.6 million customers vs. the July-September 2025 period. Domestic subscribers were up 1.2 million and international subscribers rose 2.4 million. Overall, streaming subscriptions were up 14.7 million vs. Q4 2024.

	Turning to WBDâ€™s studios segment, box office was down 11%, TV revenue was down 18% and gaming sales dropped a whopping 34%.

	Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s global linear networks saw an 8% decrease in distribution revenue and 14% drop in ad sales. WBD attributes that advertising revenue decrease primarily to U.S. audience decline of 22% and the loss of its NBA rights.

	Wall Street forecast earnings per share (EPS) of 0 cents on $9.37 billion in revenue, according to analyst consensus data provided by LSEG. WBD reported a diluted loss per share of 10 cents, or a net loss of $252 million, on $9.5 billion in revenue.

	Free cashflow stood at $1.4 billion. The companyâ€™s debt currently stands at $33.5 billion.

schema.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Cuts LossesÂ in Q4,Â Despite Box Office, TV Woes; Nears 132 Million Streaming Subs

title: No Decision Reached on Future of Berlin Film Festival Chief Tricia Tuttle
description: The governing body of the Berlin Film Festival has failed to reach a decision on whether to continue the contract of its festival director, Tricia T
body:
The governing body of the Berlin Film Festival has failed to reach a decision on whether to continue the contract of its festival director, Tricia Tuttle.

	The non-decision came at an extraordinary meeting, called by Germanyâ€™s culture minister Wolfram Weimer, of the Berlin Film Festivalâ€™s governing body, KBB GmbH, on Thursday morning to discuss the â€œfuture directionâ€ of the Berlinale. It is believed the meeting was convened in response to criticism of political statements made at the festival.
	

	â€œThis morning, a supervisory board meeting of KBB GmbH took place in the Chancellery. The topic was the Berlinale,â€ said a spokesman for Weimer. â€œTalks on the Berlinale will continue in the coming days between the director, Tricia Tuttle, and the supervisory board.â€


	After a story in German tabloid Bild on Wednesday suggested that Tuttle was about to be sacked, film business insiders and Berlinale staffer rallied to her defense. A petition supporting her, signed by film professionals â€“ including luminaries such as Sean Baker, Todd Haynes, Tilda Swinton and Kleber MendonÃ§a Filho â€“ rapidly gathered around 700 names (it has now exceeded 1,000).

	Then, on Thursday morning, more than 500 staffers at the festival wrote an open letter to voice their support for Tuttle. 

	The letter stated: â€œWe do not exaggerate when we say, as one, that it is unlikely the KBB Supervisory Board could have appointed a more intelligent, ethical and responsive leader for the Berlinale, nor one more dedicated to the core principles that make this festival a vital platform for cinema in Germany and internationally.
	

	â€œWe hope this message will go some way to communicating the extent of the admiration and loyalty Tricia has inspired in all who are invested in the future of the Berlinale, and the future of cinema.â€

	During its 76th edition, running Feb. 12-22, the festival was at first accused of censoring political talk when prominent attendees, including jury president Wim Wenders, declined to discuss politics. But the controversy blew up when on closing night, several prize-winners used their acceptance speeches to voice support for Palestine and Gaza.

schema.headline: No Decision Reached on Future of Berlin Film Festival Chief Tricia Tuttle

title: Bille August Sets Julius Caesar TV Series After Scoring Global Hit With â€˜Count of Monte Cristoâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Oscar-winning director Bille August, who recently scored a global hit with TV series â€œThe Count of Monte Cristo,â€ is set for another high-end period
body:
Oscar-winning director Bille August, who recently scored a global hit with TV series â€œThe Count of Monte Cristo,â€ is set for another high-end period show that this time will hark back to Ancient Rome and delve into the timely figure of Julius Caesar.

	Underlining the projectâ€™s â€œcontemporaryâ€ relevance, August, in an exclusive statement for Variety, pointed out that â€œThe Republic of Rome was the first democracy to be undermined by a government that elected a dictator, granting him absolute powers.â€ 
	

	The series, working-titled â€œJulius Caesar,â€ will explore â€œthe story of a great leader intoxicated by power,â€ the Danish director added, â€œuncovering the deep psychological complexities ultimately leading from the most epic feats to his downfall.â€


	August, who won an Oscar for â€œPelle the Conqueror,â€ and is also a double Palme dâ€™Or winner for â€œPelleâ€ and â€œSmillaâ€™s Sense Of Snow,â€ has reunited with screenwriter Greg Latter â€“ whom he worked with on â€œGoodbye Bafana,â€ â€œNight Train to Lisbonâ€ and upcoming film â€œMe, Youâ€ â€“ on the â€œJulius Caesarâ€ project. Itâ€™s being produced by Italyâ€™s Mediawan-owned Palomar, the company that also lead-produced â€œMonte Cristo.â€

	Filming, which will take place in Italy, is scheduled for early 2027. There are no casting details as yet.

	â€œIn todayâ€™s world, shaken by the spectre of war, it seems to us that taking on the challenge of portraying an extraordinary character such as Julius Caesar â€“ unique orator, infallible strategist, far-sighted politician and great commander â€” is more relevant than ever,â€ said Palomar founder and CEO Carlo Degli Esposti, who is also a member of the Mediawan board.
	

	â€œIt has never been as crucial as today to highlight the story of such a contradictory man,â€ Degli Esposti continued. He called Julius Caesar ambitious and generous â€œbut also cruel; a mixture of greatness and corruption exercised by power. By the desire to conquer power and maintain it, even at the cost of his life.â€

	Previous TV series that delved into the tale of Julius Caesar include 2005-2007 Emmy-winning HBO/BBC series â€œRomeâ€ that chronicled the fall of the Roman Republic and Caesarâ€™s rise to power; TNTâ€™s pulpy 2002 miniseries â€œCaesar,â€ starring Jeremy Sisto in the title role; and 2023 BBC docudrama â€œJulius Caesar: The Making of a Dictator.â€

	Augustâ€™s lushly lensed adaptation of Alexandre Dumasâ€™ â€œThe Count of Monte Cristo,â€ toplining Sam Claflin (â€œPeaky Blindersâ€) and Ana Girardot (â€œThe Returnedâ€), scored record-breaking ratings on Italian state broadcaster RAI and was sold widely by Mediawan around the world.

schema.headline: Bille August Sets Julius Caesar TV Series After Scoring Global Hit With â€˜Count of Monte Cristoâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Janus Films Buys Alain Gomisâ€™ Family Epic â€˜DAOâ€™ for North America (EXCLUSIVE)
description: French directorÂ Alain Gomisâ€˜ â€œDAO,â€ a sprawling family epic which world premiered in competition at the Berlin Film Festival, has been acquired by J
body:
French directorÂ Alain Gomisâ€˜ â€œDAO,â€ a sprawling family epic which world premiered in competition at the Berlin Film Festival, has been acquired by Janus Films for North American distribution. 

	Represented internationally by The Party Film Sales, the film marked Gomisâ€™ return to the Berlinale nine years after winning the Silver Bear for â€œFÃ©licitÃ©.â€ Gomisâ€™ sixth feature, â€œDAOâ€ emerged as one of the best reviewed films of the festival.
	

	Varietyâ€˜s Guy Lodge described the film as Gomisâ€™ â€œmost vibrantly expansive and accessibleâ€ film.


	â€œDAOâ€ unfolds between a wedding in France and a commemorative ceremony in Guinea-Bissau. Gomis, who has Bissau-Guinean and Senegalese origins, wrote and directed the film which stars a mix of actors and newcomers, leading with Katy Correa and Dâ€™JohÃ© Kouadio as a mother-and-daughter duo. 

	Although â€œDAOâ€ is more intimate than political, Gomis subtly addresses timely themes, such as the impact of colonization, displacement and inherited trauma.

	â€œEach family carries its secrets. Here, thereâ€™s something about people who were formed through an absence, whose image of themselves needs repairing,â€ he said in an interview with Variety. Referring to the generational gap between those who stayed in Africa, and those who emigrated, he explains that â€œsome things werenâ€™t explored, werenâ€™t spoken. You grow up with the feeling that something is missing.â€

	The Party Film Sales has also closed major international deals on the film to Flamingo in Spain, Films That Matter in Germany, as well as Fivia and MCF MegaComFilm in ex-Yugoslavia.
	

	In France, the film will be released theatrically on April 29 by Jour2fÃªte, the sister company to The Party Film Sales. â€œDAOâ€ was produced by Les Films du Worso and Srab Films (â€œLes Miserablesâ€).

schema.headline: Janus Films Buys Alain Gomisâ€™ Family Epic â€˜DAOâ€™ for North America (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Joko Anwarâ€™s â€˜Ghost in the Cellâ€™ Sells to Multiple Territories Following Berlin Premiere (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Joko Anwarâ€™s horror-comedy â€œGhost in the Cellâ€ has secured distribution across multiple territories following its world premiere at the Berlin Film
body:
Joko Anwarâ€™s horror-comedy â€œGhost in the Cellâ€ has secured distribution across multiple territories following its world premiere at the Berlin Film Festival, with Barunson E&A unveiling sales from the European Film Market.

	Well Go USA has acquired North American rights to the Indonesia-South Korea co-production, which follows inmates in a violent Indonesian prison who must unite for survival when a supernatural entity begins targeting those with the darkest auras. Additional confirmed distributors include The World Pictures for Russia and CIS, La Aventura for Spain and Spanish-speaking territories, Calendar Studios for Taiwan, Shinesaeng Ad. Venture for Thailand theatrical rights, Purple Plan Pte for Singapore, Cambodia and Vietnam theatrical rights, Filmbridge for Mongolia, and the previously announced Plaion Pictures for Germany and German-speaking territories. Negotiations are ongoing on several additional territories, including Benelux.
	

	â€œWeâ€™re thrilled to bring â€˜Ghost in the Cellâ€™ to North America,â€ said Doris Pfardrescher, president and CEO of Well Go USA. â€œAs longtime fans of Joko Anwar, having previously released his film â€˜Gundala,â€™ weâ€™ve seen firsthand how strongly his work resonates with audiences here. â€˜Ghost in the Cellâ€™ is an absolute blast â€“ itâ€™s wildly entertaining and deliciously gory in all the right ways.â€


	Purple Plan Pte added: â€œWe acquired â€˜Ghost in the Cellâ€™ because itâ€™s bold, unapologetic, and wildly entertaining. Its gory, high-impact action and horror elements create a thrilling experience. Under the direction of prolific storyteller Joko Anwar, the film has a distinctive voice that sets it apart from others in the genre. Weâ€™re excited to bring it to Singapore, Vietnam and Cambodia giving audiences a brand-new horror experience.â€
	

	The film, which premiered in the Berlinale Forum, addresses Indonesiaâ€™s deforestation crisis through its supernatural premise. â€œThe environmental and political realities have always been the origin of horror, not only as a sideshow,â€ Anwar told Variety in an interview. â€œI let the ghost carry the truth that the system made by humans refuses to articulate.â€

	The production represents a collaboration between Anwar and producer Tia Hasibuan through their Jakarta-based Come and See Pictures, alongside Rapi Films, Barunson E&A and Legacy Pictures. The ensemble cast features Abimana Aryasatya, Lukman Sardi, Bront Palarae, Aming, Rio Dewanto, Morgan Oey and Tora Sudiro.

	The film is scheduled for Indonesian theatrical release in the second quarter of 2026.â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

schema.headline: Joko Anwarâ€™s â€˜Ghost in the Cellâ€™ Sells to Multiple Territories Following Berlin Premiere (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Catherine Deneuve Co-Authors â€˜Marilyn ChÃ©rie,â€™ Timed to Marilyn Monroeâ€™s 100th Birthday (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Catherine Deneuve has co-authored a book dedicated to the late icon, â€œMarilyn chÃ©rie,â€ which will come out in May to mark the centenary of her birth
body:
Catherine Deneuve has co-authored a book dedicated to the late icon, â€œMarilyn chÃ©rie,â€ which will come out in May to mark the centenary of her birth.

	In the book, which she wrote with collector SÃ©bastien Cauchon, Deneuve delivers a personal look at photographs of Monroe, including set photos, costume fittings, portraits by leading photographers, press images and amateur shots. The curated stills, many of which have never been published before, come from Cauchonâ€™s private collection, among others.
	

	Deneuve, herself a cinema icon, is a longtime Monroe devotee and has been influenced by her work. She previously participated in the documentary, â€œMarilyn, dite Norma Jean,â€ which aired on television in 1987. Deneuve also starred with Monroeâ€™s partner in â€œSome Like It Hot,â€ Jack Lemmon, in his first American film, â€œThe April Fools,â€ in 1968; and with Yves Montand â€” who had starred opposite Monroe in â€œLetâ€™s Make Loveâ€ â€” in Jean-Paul Rappeneauâ€™s â€œLe Sauvageâ€ in 1975.


	â€œSo beautiful, so open, almost unknown. So generous with her body, her face tilted back, something childlike too â€” which never makes her seem indecent. The actress whose films I have seen all, never known, the most precious to me,â€ Deneuve writes in â€œMarilyn chÃ©rie.â€

	The 224-page book is set to be published by Flammarion, which holds the worldwide publishing rights. Deneuve and Cauchon retain the adaptation rights.

	Cauchon, who currently works as an awards strategist, previously wrote the book â€œMarilyn 1962,â€ which was published by Stock in 2016 and was optioned for a miniseries project. His Marilyn Monroe photo archive collection was presented at an exhibition hosted by Cannes Film Festival chief Thierry FrÃ©maux during the 2022 edition of the LumiÃ¨re Festival.

schema.headline: Catherine Deneuve Co-Authors â€˜Marilyn ChÃ©rie,â€™ Timed to Marilyn Monroeâ€™s 100th Birthday (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Jonathan Groff to Lead All-Male â€˜As You Like Itâ€™ as Royal Shakespeare Company Unveils 2026-27 Season
description: The Royal Shakespeare Company has unveiled its 2026-27 season, headlined by Tony Award-winning Broadway star Jonathan Groff making his RSC debut as
body:
The Royal Shakespeare Company has unveiled its 2026-27 season, headlined by Tony Award-winning Broadway star Jonathan Groff making his RSC debut as Rosalind in an all-male staging of Shakespeareâ€™s â€œAs You Like It,â€ directed by RSC co-artistic director Daniel Evans.

	Groff, who can currently be seen starring in â€œJust in Timeâ€ at New Yorkâ€™s Circle in the Square Theatre, previously originated the roles of Melchior Gabor in â€œSpring Awakeningâ€ and Kristoff in Disneyâ€™s â€œFrozenâ€ franchise, and claimed his Tony for his portrayal of Franklin Shepherd in the recent â€œMerrily We Roll Alongâ€ revival. He will be joined by Fisayo Akinade as Celia. Akinade earned screen recognition through Russell T. Daviesâ€™ Channel 4 series â€œCucumberâ€ and â€œBanana,â€ and appeared as Mr. Ajayi in the 2022 Netflix series â€œHeartstopper.â€ The production runs Sept. 26 through Nov. 7 in the Royal Shakespeare Theatre.
	

	Harriet Walter will return to the company to reprise her role as Brutus in a revival of Phyllida Lloydâ€™s 2012 Donmar Warehouse production of â€œJulius Caesar,â€ originally staged under artistic director Josie Rourke and executive director Kate Pakenham. The all-female production is set in a womenâ€™s prison. The revival, co-produced with KPPL Productions, will tour to secondary schools across England from Sept. 21 through Oct. 23 before a run at The Other Place from Nov. 5-28.


	The school tour anchors the RSCâ€™s celebration of two decades of educational partnership work. The companyâ€™s Associate Schools Program now reaches more than 280 schools across 100 towns and cities in England. Each performance will be supported by workshops and post-show discussions, with the touring program culminating in a Young Creatives Festival at The Other Place on Nov. 21.
	

	The Swan Theatre will stage a two-part dramatization of George Eliotâ€™s â€œMiddlemarch,â€ with Nina Raine writing the adaptation and Jeremy Herrin directing, in a co-production with Second Half Productions. Part 1 opens Oct. 1, Part 2 follows Oct. 10, with both running through Jan. 16.

	Rounding out the season, theater company Told by an Idiot brings Alexandre Dumasâ€™ â€œThe Three Musketeersâ€ to the Royal Shakespeare Theatre in a new adaptation written and directed by company co-founder and artistic director Paul Hunter. The production runs Nov. 28 through Jan. 9.

	The previously announced world premiere of â€œGame of Thrones: The Mad King,â€ written by Duncan Macmillan and directed by Dominic Cooke, arrives at the Royal Shakespeare Theatre in summer 2026, in a co-production involving Simon Painter, Tim Lawson, Mark Manuel, Warner Bros. Theatre Ventures on behalf of HBO, and Sir Leonard Blavatnik and Danny Cohen for Access Entertainment. 

	RSC co-artistic directors Daniel Evans and Tamara Harvey described the season as one where themes of â€œidentity, transformation, freedom, justice and the liberation that comes from breaking free of expectations loom large this autumn, as classic stories and universal struggles take on powerful new resonance in the hands of some of the most exciting artists of today.â€

schema.headline: Jonathan Groff to Lead All-Male â€˜As You Like Itâ€™ as Royal Shakespeare Company Unveils 2026-27 Season

title: Warner Bros. and BFI Veteran Josh Berger Joins Board of â€˜Moleyâ€™ Producer Two Daughters Entertainment (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Joshua (Josh) Berger has joined the board of Two Daughters Entertainment as non-executive director and strategic advisor. 

	The appointment brings
body:
Joshua (Josh) Berger has joined the board of Two Daughters Entertainment as non-executive director and strategic advisor. 

	The appointment brings one of the U.K. entertainment industryâ€™s most experienced executives to a company expanding beyond its TV roots into features and global IP.

	The immediate catalyst is the companyâ€™s debut theatrical release, â€œThe Land of Sometimes,â€ due in cinemas worldwide this spring. Beyond that, Two Daughters is moving toward greenlighting a second feature while developing a broader slate of original animated properties â€“ a significant step up in ambition for a company founded by James Reatchlous in 2016.
	

	Two Daughters built its reputation on â€œMoley,â€ an animated property that started life as a half-hour special and has since reached audiences in 180 countries across 30 languages, with distribution partnerships including Peacock in the U.S. and Youku/iQiyi in China.


	â€œThe Land of Sometimesâ€ assembles a notable cast and creative team. Ewan McGregor, Mel Brooks and Helena Bonham Carter head the voice cast, while Tim Rice, who won an Academy Award for his work on â€œThe Lion King,â€ contributed original music and lyrics. Leon Joosen, whose credits include â€œSaving Santa,â€ directs. Among the executive producers are Bonnie Arnold, a veteran of the â€œToy Storyâ€ and â€œHow to Train Your Dragonâ€ franchises, and the late Alan Yentob, the BBC figure behind â€œBilly Elliot,â€ alongside Reatchlous and CEO Simon Bobin.

	Berger spent 31 years at Warner Bros. Entertainment, rising to president and managing director of its U.K., Ireland and Spain operations before taking charge of â€œHarry Potterâ€ global franchise development â€“ a role that put him at the center of one of the entertainment industryâ€™s most lucrative IP empires. He was also instrumental in the studioâ€™s acquisition of Leavesden Studios and the development of Warner Bros. Studio Tour London â€“ The Making of Harry Potter.
	

	Berger was appointed CBE in the Queenâ€™s 2012 Birthday Honors for services to the U.K.â€™s creative industries. Beyond Warner Bros., he has been a prominent figure in British cultural life, serving as former chair and board member of the British Film Institute, as well as former board member of the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. Currently, he is founder and chair of Battersea Entertainment and chair of trustees at The BRIT School. His producing credits include Guy Ritchieâ€™s â€œThe Covenant,â€ the Broadway musical â€œAinâ€™t Too Proud: The Life and Times of The Temptationsâ€ and executive producer credit on â€œFantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore.â€

	â€œTwo Daughters Entertainment is entering an exciting new chapter. With its first feature about to be released, a strong slate coming behind it, and a clear ambition to build enduring global IP, this is a company with momentum, creative integrity and real heart. â€˜Moleyâ€™ is already a distinctive international brand, and James and Simon have assembled an impressive team and vision. Iâ€™m delighted to be joining the board at such a significant moment and to support the companyâ€™s continued growth,â€ said Berger.

	Reatchlous said: â€œJosh joining the board at this moment is incredibly meaningful for us. As we complete our first feature, prepare to greenlight our next, and continue to develop an exciting slate of original properties, his experience growing world-class IP and navigating global franchises is invaluable. We are thrilled to welcome him to Two Daughters.â€

	Added Simon Bobin, CEO of Two Daughters Entertainment: â€œJosh is one of the most respected leaders in the global entertainment industry. His insight into building premium franchises, scaling businesses internationally and supporting creative ambition comes at exactly the right time for Two Daughters. As we expand our film slate and IP portfolio, his guidance will be a huge asset to the company.â€

schema.headline: Warner Bros. and BFI Veteran Josh Berger Joins Board of â€˜Moleyâ€™ Producer Two Daughters Entertainment (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Eddie Huang In 'Fresh Off The Boat' 'Memba Him?!
description:
Eddie Huang In
                          'Fresh Off The Boat'
                          'Memba Hi
body:

          Hudson was part of an ensemble cast including Constance Wu, Randall Park and Forrest Wheeler.

title: Carmen Electra Trusts the Wayans to Write a 'Scary Movie' That's Un-Cancelable
body:
Carmen Electra
                          'Scary Movie 6' Won't Get 'Canceled' ...
                          The Wayans Are Too Good at What They Do!!!
                      
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          With "Scary Movie 6" hitting theaters this year, we got Carmen Electra to dish on how she thinks the raunchy film franchise will do in the age of "cancel culture."
      
    
          Remember ... Carmen starred in the first installment of the film franchise in 2000, which contained at least one or two jokes that wouldn't pass today. But Carmen says the Wayans brothers are skilled enough to make a comedy for any time.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          She told us, "I haven't seen the script, so I'm not exactly sure what the new 'Scary Movie' is exactly going to be about. But I think for the most part, it's so lighthearted and as long as it's in the right context, I think it'll be okay."
      

          She continued ... "The Wayans are not careful, but they're geniuses at what they do, so it'll definitely be some fun."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Keenan Ivory, Marlon and Shawn Wayans returned to write the script for the movie, expected this June. The announced cast includes Regina Hall, Anna Faris, Cheri Oteri, Damon Wayans Jr., Kim Wayans, Heidi Gardner and more.
      
    
          Carmen wouldn't reveal to us whether she's returning or not ... so we're just gonna have to watch to find out!

title: NeNe Leakes Seen Kissing Memphis Attorney at Grizzlies Game
description:
NeNe Leakes
                          Locks Lips W/ New Man Courtside at Grizzles Game!!!
body:
NeNe Leakes
                          Locks Lips W/ New Man Courtside at Grizzles Game!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 25, 2026
                            7:50 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          NeNe Leakes isn't hiding her new man â€¦ she's showing him off.
      
    
          TMZ obtained video of the former "Real Housewives of Atlanta" star at Wednesday night's Memphis Grizzlies game with attorney Arthur Horne III and at one point, he leans in and plants a kiss on her as they walk out together.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Earlier in the night, the two were posted up courtside, cuddled close and clearly coupled up. Witnesses tell us they were "hugged up" and "really touchy-feely" throughout the game ... making it crystal clear this wasn't just a friendly outing.
      

          Horne III runs his own law firm in Memphis, practicing criminal defense and personal injury law.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Of course, NeNe's love life has been closely followed over the years. She was married to Gregg Leakes from 1997 to 2011 before they remarried in 2013. They remained together until Greggâ€™s death from colon cancer in September 2021.
      
    
          Following Gregg's passing, NeNe began dating fashion entrepreneur Nyonisela Sioh later that year. Their relationship made headlines amid legal drama involving his estranged wife, and by 2023 NeNe confirmed they were taking a break though reconciliation rumors later swirled.
      
    
          We broke the story ... NeNe is set to appear on Bravo's "The Real Housewives Ultimate Girls Trip: Roaring 20th." While she wonâ€™t be full-time, we're told sheâ€™ll have a notable presence.
      
    
          We've reached out to NeNe and Horne for comment â€¦ so far, no word back.
      
      
              
          
                          
                NeNe Leakes

schema.headline: NeNe Leakes Seen Kissing Memphis Attorney at Grizzlies Game

title: Bianca Censori Rocks Pink Hair With Skimpy Outfit
description:
Bianca Censori
                          On Wednesdays I Wear Pink
body:
Bianca Censori
                          On Wednesdays I Wear Pink
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 25, 2026
                            6:09 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
          Bianca Censori is strutting her stuff in a skimpy skirt and a top that shows off her breasts ... but it's what's above the shoulders that should be catching everyone's eye here.
      
    
          Check out these photos of Kanye West's wife going out Wednesday in Los Angeles ... she's rocking pink hair!!!
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The hair color is different, but everything else is the same old Bianca -- lots of boobs and lots of leg -- thanks to a silver mini skirt and a top that looks more like a bra than a traditional shirt.
      

          Bianca recently had long, dark hair when we saw her going to an L.A. medspa for Valentine's Day ... but now she's chopped her locks down to a pixie cut and dyed her hair pink.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          No word on what inspired Bianca to switch up her hairstyle ... but she was on her way to an art exhibit at the Roosevelt Hotel when photogs snapped her.
